content.description:
I spent half a day deep cleaning this climb and got a whole lot of rock off of it. Now it is mostly clean and exfoliated.

A worth-while and fun hand crack with good protection.
content.protection: Bring med-large stoppers, single .3, to #3. Doubles in 0.5, 0.75, #1 will not go unused
content.location:
Stacked washer bolted anchors 15-20ft to the skiers left of cornerstone anchors.

Rappel in, to a set of anchors (new looking bolts) below. Belay from here. Getting to this point from the ground appears to be quite terrible quality.

content.description: This was listed as 11b and if it is then 90% of it is with 5% being 10d and 5% being 12a, and being about 120' that is very sustained 11b. I found this to be pretty clean, but did clean a bunch of loose holds. The start is about 30' of interesting face climbing with zero gear in about the 11a range. Then there is about 90' of 1/2" crack with some cool face hold stemming.
content.protection:
The first placements take

red ballnuts.

After that,

it is about 100' of #.3- #.5 with a couple of hand jams that would take #2- #3. There are constrictions that would work for medium/

large

nuts.

A couple

0.2 sized cams are very helpful.

Bolted rap anchor.

70 meter rope

is not long enough to TR or rappel.
content.location:
There is a bolted route just left of this route.

Directly above the 2nd Talus slope on the left side of the Lesbian wall.
